page.title: 12Bideford:S+SE.Combining.
page.content: __Cont.)Good weather is also very impor -tant.We have to do a lot of preparat- ion for corn harvest.We have to grease the combine in different places so that it is all in working order.We have to change and sharpen the knives.When all this is done we are ready to start.We have about 64 acres of our own to cut as well.Grandfather helps by taking his combine out contracting.We also have some wheat to cut with an old fashioned binder for thatching.When we have done all this we have to bale the straw and get that into the barn.A neighbouring farmer usually helps mum and I do this. Corn harvest is a very long and tiring time.We usually get up at 7 o'clock and take dad and 'Father to their combines. We help them unsheet,refuel and grease. We usually finish baling at 9 o'clock in the evening,and then go and fetch th -em.Tho'it's long and tiring I enjoy it
